rule.definition: The first Element ID must equal 172351395

EBMLVersion is the version of EBML to which the document conforms to. (5.1.1). The minimum EBML version a parser has to support in order to read the document. (5.1.2). Therefore, the EBMLReadVersion must be equal or less than the EBMLVersion.

DocTypeVersion is the version of document type to which the document conforms to (5.1.6). The minimum DocType version an interpreter has to support in order to read the document (5.1.7). Therefore, the DocTypeReadVersion must be equal or less than the DocTypeVersion.

rule.name: EBML vint efficiency
rule.definition: Section 2.2 "IDs are always encoded in their shortest form, e.g. 1 is always encoded as 0x81 and never as 0x4001." The bits following the Element ID's Length Descriptor are not more than (8 - ${bit-length-of-length-descriptor}) successive 0 bits, i.e. vint is expressed as efficiently as feasible.

rule.name: Element ID Registered
rule.definition: Ensure MKV Element ID is registered in specdata.xml (as of Dec. 13, 2014 this is 224 registered Element IDs)

rule.name: Element Size 0x7F Reservation
rule.definition: "Note that the shortest encoding form for 127 is 0x407f since 0x7f is reserved." If Element Size is set to 0x11111111 but element size is actually 127 bytes provide a warning.

rule.name: Element Size Byte Length Limit
rule.definition: Section 2.3: "The EBML element data size is encoded as a variable size integer with, by default, widths up to 8." The first eight bits of any Element Size may not start with 0b00000000.

rule.name: Element Size Unknown
rule.definition: "Values with all data bits set to 1 means size unknown, which allows for dynamically generated EBML streams where the final size isn't known beforehand." Warning on unknown element sizes, unoptimized MKV.
